hero.canaryWarning: This is a canary build. Bugs may be present, and your projects may break when the final version is released. You should not use this version for creating non-test projects.
appShortDescription: {APP_NAME} is a block-based programming language built off TurboWarp that adds many small but meaningful features to Scratch to make it even better.
appDescription: {APP_NAME} is a block-based programming language built off TurboWarp that adds many small but meaningful features to Scratch to make it even better, such as first-class lists, case sensitivity, and custom extensions.
buildEasily: Build a game easily with block-based programming!
buildEasilyText: With {APP_NAME}, you can create games, animations, art, and more quickly by dragging blocks instead of manually typing everything out.
jsCompile: {APP_NAME} compiles projects to JavaScript to make them run faster than in vanilla Scratch.
arraysFeature: With arrays, you can create complex list structures and store them as variables.
extensionsFeature: To make {APP_NAME} more powerful, dozens of new unsandboxed extensions are added.
newFonts: {APP_NAME} features new fonts like Comic and Amplification to use in your costumes and backdrops.
roundedRectangle: Creating a rounded rectangle has never been easier with the Rounded Rectangle tool.
customFonts: Custom fonts can be loaded from system font name or a font file.
amp.footer.disclaimer: {APP_NAME} is not affiliated with {scratchLink} or {twLink}. Support Scratch by {supportScratch}.
credits.title: {APP_NAME} Credits
credits.totalContributors: There are {totalContributors} contributors to {APP_NAME} in total, and this is growing!
credits.disclaimer.general: Individual contributors are listed in no particular order. The order is randomized each visit. Users who only made very minor contributions are not included.
credits.exampleProjectsDescription: You can find information about who created an example on the page for that example.
credits.ampmodDescription: {APP_NAME} is based on the work of the AmpMod contributors but is not endorsed by AmpMod in any way.
credits.turbowarpDescription: {APP_NAME} is based on the work of the TurboWarp contributors but is not endorsed by TurboWarp in any way.
credits.scratchDescription: {APP_NAME} is based on the work of the Scratch contributors but is not endorsed by Scratch in any way.
credits.scratchDonate: Donate to support TurboWarp and Scratch.
credits.otherModsDescription: {APP_NAME} uses code from other open-source Scratch modifications but is not endorsed by any of them in any way.
credits.faviconDescription: The {APP_NAME} favicon is based off an emoji from the {forumoji} project by lolecksdeehaha.
credits.translatorsDescription: Our community has helped translate {APP_NAME} into many languages. More information will be available soon.
credits.artDescription: Some images use content from Openclipart, licensed under the CC0 license. Even though the images are public domain, we would still like to attribute.
examples.title: Examples
examples.introduction: Click an example to learn more about it. Then, click "Open" to open it and experiment with {APP_NAME}!
examples.licenceText: These examples are licenced under a {ccLink} licence. Therefore, if you distribute these examples on another website, you must provide credit to the creator. {imageAttribution}
examples.unsupported: This project is not supported on your browser or system. It, or parts of it, may not work. The description may provide more context.
examples.apz.griffpatch.description: {APP_NAME}'s Box2D extension allows you to add 2-dimensional physics to your games.
examples.apz.battery.description: The Battery extension can get the battery percentage of your device.
faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.why.a1: Scratch is tightly controlled by its developers at the Scratch Foundation, who target it at beginners. Because of this, the Scratch Team has rejected several complex features, and people eventually stop using it and learn languages like Python instead.
faq.why.a2: However, we do believe block-based programming allows people to quickly build projects. That's why we made {APP_NAME} - an advanced modification of Scratch.
faq.opensource.q: Where can I find the {APP_NAME} source code?
faq.opensource.a: You can see the {APP_NAME} source code {onCodeberg} under multiple licences (this is clarified in the LICENSE.md file).
faq.philosophy.intro: The {APP_NAME} philosophy helps our moderators, developers, and contributors make decisions regarding {APP_NAME}. Here are the 3 principles of it:
faq.philosophy.learn: Be easy to learn for Scratchers.
faq.philosophy.understand: Be easy to understand for advanced programmers.
faq.browsers.a: {APP_NAME} is primarily tested on Firefox and Chrome. Most browsers released in the last 2 years should hopefully work.
faq.updates.a: {APP_NAME} receives several patch updates per year to fix bugs, and a few occasional minor releases with new features.
faq.extensions.a: Custom extensions are extensions in {APP_NAME} that are not available in the official Scratch editor. They can range from unsandboxed extensions on the official {APP_NAME} extension gallery to sandboxed extensions on third-party hosts.
faq.performance.a: Yes! {APP_NAME} uses slightly less memory than vanilla Scratch, and only slightly more than TurboWarp.
faq.contribute.a: We're always looking for contributors! Check out the {applicationsTagOnForums} on the forums to see what you can help with.
